00346 
00347 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00348 //
00349 //  Structures -- PiPL types.
00350 //
00351 //  Below are structures describing types used in plug-in property lists.
00352 //  These structures obey Macintosh 68k alignment and padding rules though
00353 //  generally they are laid out so fields have natural alignment and any
00354 //  needed padding is explicit in the structure.
00355 //
00356 //  In addition to these structure types, simple types such as int32, int16,
00357 //  etc. are used. Two other examples are PString and FlagSet.
00358 //
00359 //  PString is like a rez pstring or a Str255 except that storage may not
00360 //  be present for all 255 characters.  The initial length byte is present
00361 //  in the property.
00362 //
00363 //  FlagSet is a variable length bitstring in which the first member is
00364 //  represented by the most significant bit of the first byte, the eighth
00365 //  member is in the least significant bit of the first byte, etc.
00366 //  The length of the set is in the property's length field.
00367 //
00368 //  Arrays are also used in places with bounds either taken from the
00369 //  property length or explicitly represented within the property.
00370 //
00371 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00372 
00374 typedef struct PI68KCodeDesc
00375 {
00379     PIType fType;
00380 
00382     int16 fID;
00383 
00384 } PI68KCodeDesc;
00385 
00387 typedef struct PICFMCodeDesc
00388 {
00391     int32 fContainerOffset;
00392     
00396     int32 fContainerLength;
00397     
00405     unsigned char fEntryName[1];
00406 
00407 } PICFMCodeDesc;
00408 
00410 typedef struct PIMachOCodeDesc
00411 {
00414     int32 fContainerOffset;
00415     
00419     int32 fContainerLength;
00420     
00428     unsigned char fEntryName[1];
00429 
00430 } PIMachOCodeDesc;
00431 
00432 // For 'mi32' PICodeMacIntel32Property:
00433 // For 'mi64' PICodeMacIntel64Property:
00434 typedef struct PIMacIntelCodeDesc
00435 {
00436 
00437     // Name of entrypoint ("main", "ENTRYPOINT", "", etc.):
00438     unsigned char fEntryName[1];
00439 
00440 } PIMacIntelCodeDesc;
00441 
00444 typedef struct PIFragmentCodeDesc
00445 {
00447     int32 fFragmentResource;
00448     
00450     int32 fFragmentNumber;
00451     
00454     unsigned char fEntryName[1];
00455 
00456 } PIFragmentCodeDesc;
00457 
00462 typedef struct PIWin64X86CodeDesc
00463 {
00464     char fEntryName[1];
00465 } PIWin64X86CodeDesc;
00466 
00471 typedef struct PIWin32X86CodeDesc {
00472     char fEntryName[1];
00473 } PIWin32X86CodeDesc;
00474 
00477 typedef struct PIWin16X86CodeDesc {
00478     char fEntryName[1];
00479 } PIWin16X86CodeDesc;

00490 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00491 
00493 // 'vers' <int32> Major<int16>.Minor<int16> version number:
00508 #define PIVersionProperty       0x76657273L
00509 
00511 // 'prty' <int32> Load order priority:
00520 #define PIPriorityProperty      0x70727479L
00521 
00523 // 'cmpt' Component/Version ids:
00528 #define PIComponentProperty     0x636d7074L
00529 
00531 // 'mode' <FlagSet> Image modes supported flags. (bitmask):
00543 #define PIImageModesProperty    0x6d6f6465L
00544 
00546 // 'enbl' <CString> Enabling expression:
00557 #define PIEnableInfoProperty    0x656e626cL
00558 
00560 // 'wnsc' plug in wants scrap
00565 #define PIWantsScrapProperty    0x776E7363L
00566 
00568 // 'coco' plug in has Cocoa, Objective-C code and should never be unloaded
00574 #define PICocoaProperty     0x636F636FL
00575 
00577 // 'fbaw' plug in wants in the File Browser menu
00582 #define PIFileBrowserAwareProperty  0x66626177L
00583 
00585 // 'nabo' plug in does not want an about box menu entry
00590 #define PINoAboutBoxProperty    0x6E61626FL
00591 
00593 // 'flly' plug in filter layer properties
00599 #define PIFilterLayerSupport    0x666c6c79L
00600 
00602 // 'host' <PIType> giving host required if any:
00609 #define PIRequiredHostProperty  0x686f7374L
00610 
00612 // 'catg' <PString> Category name that appears on top level menu:
00620 #define PICategoryProperty      0x63617467L
00621 
00623 // 'zcat' <PString> Category name that appears on top level menu:
00631 #define PIZCategoryProperty     0x7A636174L
00632 
00634 // 'name' <PString> Menu name:
00642 #define PINameProperty          0x6e616d65L
00643 
00645 // 'znam' <PString> Menu name:
00653 #define PIZNameProperty         0x7A6E616DL
00654 
00656 // 'prog' <PString> Progress text:
00665 #define PIProgressTextProperty  0x70726f67
00666 
00668 // 'zpro' <PString> Progress text:
00677 #define PIZProgressTextProperty 0x7A70726F
00678 
00680 // 'pnme' <CString> picker ID:
00692 #define PIPickerIDProperty      0x706e6d65L
00693 
00695 // '68fp' <PI68KCodeDesc> 68k w/FPU code descriptor. See struct below.
00700 #define PI68KFPUCodeProperty    0x36386670L
00701 
00703 // 'usp7' SPARC version 7:
00706 #define PIUnixSPARCV7CodeProperty   0x75737037
00707

00718 #define PIUnixSPARCV9CodeProperty   0x75737039
00719 
00721 
00723 #define PIUnixSPARCCodeProperty PIUnixSPARCV7CodeProperty
00724 
00726 // 'umr3' MIPS R3000:
00729 #define PIUnixMIPSR3000CodeProperty 0x756d7233
00730 
00732 // 'umr4' MIPS R4000:
00735 #define PIUnixMIPSR4000CodeProperty 0x756d7234
00736 
00738 // 'um4w' MIPS R4000 (can be 64 bit):
00741 #define PIUnixMIPSR400064BitCodeProperty    0x756d3477
00742 
00744 // 'umr8' MIPS R8000 (always 64 bit):
00747 #define PIUnixMIPSR8000CodeProperty 0x756d7238
00748 
00750 
00752 #define PIUnixMIPSCodeProperty  PIUnixMIPSR3000CodeProperty
00753 
00755 // 'piLU' plug-in supports load/unload selectors:
00759 #define PILoadUnloadProperty        0x70694c55
00760 
00762 // 'piPF' plug-in supports preferences dialog selectors:
00766 #define PIPreferencesProperty       0x70695046
00767 
00768 // 'feen' plug-in is not loaded unless this feature is enabled
00769 #define PIFeatureEnabledProperty    0x6665656e
00770 
00771 // 'posd' plug-in is position dependent
00772 #define PIPositionDependentProperty 0x706f7364

00775 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00776 //
00777 //  Additional Structures -- PiPL types.
00778 //
00779 //  Below are structures describing types used in plug-in property lists.
00780 //  These structures obey Macintosh 68k alignment and padding rules though
00781 //  generally they are laid out so fields have natural alignment and any
00782 //  needed padding is explicit in the structure.
00783 //
00784 //  In addition to these structure types, simple types such as int32, int16,
00785 //  etc. are used. Two other examples are PString and FlagSet.
00786 //
00787 //  PString is like a rez pstring or a Str255 except that storage may not
00788 //  be present for all 255 characters.  The initial length byte is present
00789 //  in the property.
00790 //
00791 //  FlagSet is a variable length bitstring in which the first member is
00792 //  represented by the most significant bit of the first byte, the eighth
00793 //  member is in the least significant bit of the first byte, etc.
00794 //  The length of the set is in the property's length field.
00795 //
00796 //  Arrays are also used in places with bounds either taken from the
00797 //  property length or explicitly represented within the property.
00798 //

01411 #define kCurrentMinVersWriteChannelDesc 0    
01413 #define kCurrentMaxVersWriteChannelDesc 1    
01418 typedef struct WriteChannelDesc
01419 {
01420     
01421     int32 minVersion;   
01422     int32 maxVersion;   
01424     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01425     //  Version 0 fields:
01426     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------

01441     int16 padding;          
01443     void *contextInfo;      
01445     const char *name;       
01447     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01448     //  Version 1 fields:
01449     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01451 
01452     const uint16 *unicodeName;      
01455 
01456   #ifdef __cplusplus

01458         : minVersion(0), maxVersion(0), next(NULL), port(NULL), depth(0),
01459         channelType(0), padding(0), contextInfo(NULL), name(NULL), unicodeName(NULL) {}   
01460   #endif // __cplusplus             
01461 } WriteChannelDesc;

01552         name(NULL), writePort(NULL), alphaID(0), unicodeName(NULL), isEnabled(true) {}
01553   #endif // __cplusplus             
01555 } ReadChannelDesc;

01642     } ReadLayerDesc;

01738     int32   compositeChannelCount;  
01740     int32   layerCount;         
01743     int32   alphaChannelCount;  
01745

01747     //  Version 4 fields (added in Photoshop CS3/10)
01748     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01749     
01750     // Layer mask for the target layer:
01751     ReadChannelDesc *targetSmartFilterMask;
01752                             
01753 
01754   #ifdef __cplusplus

01757           hResolution(0), vResolution(0), 
01758           targetCompositeChannels(NULL), targetTransparency(NULL), targetLayerMask(NULL),
01759           mergedCompositeChannels(NULL), mergedTransparency(NULL), alphaChannels(NULL),
01760           selection(NULL), fileSpec(NULL), layersDescriptor(NULL), documentType(0),
01761           next(NULL), iCCprofileData(NULL), iCCprofileSize(0), compositeChannelCount(0),
01762           layerCount(0), alphaChannelCount(0), targetSmartFilterMask(NULL)
01763             {
01764             }
01765   #endif // __cplusplus
01766 
01767 } ReadImageDocumentDesc;

02753 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02754 //  Suite - Matrix Math
02755 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02756 
02781 
02782 #define kPSMatrixMathSuite          "9cfaa249-e6f1-11d2-b8eb-0060b0c1f95d"
02783 #define kPSMatrixMathSuiteVersion   1  
02786 typedef struct PSMatrixMathProcs
02787     {
02788     /* kPSMatrixMathSuiteVersion == 1 functions */
02789     
02796     // if result == NULL solution is put in m 
02797     SPAPI Boolean (*Inverse) (PIAffineMatrix *m,
02798                                 PIAffineMatrix *result);
02799     
02806     SPAPI Boolean (*Equals) (const PIAffineMatrix *m1,
02807                                 const PIAffineMatrix *m2);
02808 
02814     // works in-place if result == NULL
02815     SPAPI void (*ScalarMultiply) (const real64 scalar,
02816                                         PIAffineMatrix *m,
02817                                             PIAffineMatrix *result);
02818 
02825     // if result == NULL solution is put in m2 
02826     SPAPI void (*MatrixMultiply) (const PIAffineMatrix *m1,
02827                                         PIAffineMatrix *m2,
02828                                             PIAffineMatrix *result);
02829     
02836     // if result == NULL solution is put in m 
02837     SPAPI void (*PointMultiply) (PIFloatPoint *p,
02838                                         const PIAffineMatrix *m,
02839                                             PIFloatPoint *result);
02840     
02841     
02842     // if result == NULL solution is put in p 
02843     SPAPI void (*PointsMultiply) (PIFloatPoint *p,
02844                                             int32 count,
02845                                                 const PIAffineMatrix *m,
02846                                                     PIFloatPoint *result);
02847 
02848     } PSMatrixMathProcs;
02849 
02852 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02853 //
02854 //  Defines -- Filter padding.
02855 //
02856 //  The following constants indicate what sort of padding to use.  Values 0
02857 //  through 255 specify a constant value.  Negative values imply special
02858 //  operations.
02859 //
02860 //  If the plug-in does not want padding and does not want errors, then
02861 //  exterior areas will contain arbitrary values.
02862 //
02863 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02864 
02867 
02868 #define plugInWantsEdgeReplication          -1
02869 #define plugInDoesNotWantPadding            -2   
02870 #define plugInWantsErrorOnBoundsException   -3   
02872 
02873 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02874 //  Defines -- Sampling flag
02875 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02876 
02878 
02879 #define hostDoesNotSupportSampling      0    
02880 #define hostSupportsIntegralSampling    1    
02881 #define hostSupportsFractionalSampling  2    
02883

02896 #define piLayoutColumnsRowsPlanes       3
02897 #define piLayoutColumnsPlanesRows       4
02898 #define piLayoutPlanesRowsColumns       5
02899 #define piLayoutPlanesColumnsRows       6
